revised_title: Effects of Sodium Pump Activity on Cardiac Purkinje Fibres
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of sodium pump activity on the slow inward current (Isi) and twitch tension in sheep cardiac Purkinje fibres. They found that reducing extracellular potassium concentration or applying the cardiotonic steroid strophanthidin increased Isi and twitch tension. The study concluded that these effects were mediated by sodium pump inhibition, and not by the instantaneous sodium pump turnover rate.
